oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pickard Family Performance P-7-B & P-8-B
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 1 of 7. Two recordings of the Pickard Family (performance group) from December 4th, of an unknown year. Sessions are labeled as P-7-B and P-8-B respectively and recorded in Mexico.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pickard Family
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) All Aboard for Tennessee (Pickard Family) [Featuring fiddle breakdown (Fisher's Hornpipe)] -- (00:56) Bub Pickard and Obed Pickard joke about old country and the Pickard Family talk about delegating -- (02:20) Railroad Boomer (Pickard Family) -- (05:46) The Pickard family joke about their favorite parts of "Moonlight and Roses" -- (06:41) Moonlight and Roses (Pickard Family) (09:30) Bub is introduced -- (09:48) Twin Piano Song (Pickard Family) -- (10:15) Ruthie Pickard and Charlie Pickard introduce Swallow-Tail Coat (10:30) Swallow-Tail Coat (Pickard Family) -- (11:55) It's the Old Songs that Live Forever (Pickard Family) -- (12:20) Performance change -- (12:21) All Aboard for Tennessee [Piano Duet] (Pickard Family and Little Liza Jane) -- (12:47) Obed and his father joke about his mother and introduce "Little Box of Pine on the 729" -- (13:20) Little Box of Pine on the 729 (Pickard Family) -- (16:28) Obed and Ruthie joke about playing only sad songs and Charlie and Dan request to do the next song (17:11) Long, Long Ago -- (19:35) Obed speaks praise of his family -- (19:58)[Unidentified Fiddle Tune] (Pickard Family) -- (20:16) Ruthie and Obed talk about Charlie's duet -- (20:49) The Church in the Wildwood (Pickard Family) [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Pickard Family (Musical Group)
